description: From Latin ligula (“strap, spoon”), a variant of lingula (“small tongue-shaped object”), itself partly derived from lingō (“lick”) and partly a diminutive of lingua (“tongue”).

entries.meaning: A strap or strap-shaped object, especially such a development in plants or insects.
examples: He unhasped the ligulae of his haversack, taking out a pair of blue jeans which he tossed to Bruno.
